poem:
Title: "HyperVerse Unraveled"

In pixelated galaxies we stake our claim,
Ownership of stars woven in ones and zeros.
Turning Mars to Eden in a digital game,
In the Hyper universe, no hero or heros.
"Your planet," coos the screen, a siren call,
Promising paradise where silicon rivers flow.
A perfect world, yet not tangible at all,
True wonder thrives beyond the cursor's glow.
